description.description:
The YOLOv8 Nano model is a lightweight version of the YOLOv8 object detection model. It is designed to run efficiently on resource-constrained devices such as embedded systems or edge devices. Despite its smaller size, the YOLOv8 Nano model maintains a good balance between accuracy and speed.

The model architecture of YOLOv8 Nano is based on the YOLO (You Only Look Once) approach, which performs object detection by dividing the input image into a grid and predicting bounding boxes and class probabilities for each grid cell. It utilizes a series of convolutional layers, followed by upsampling and concatenation operations, to extract features at different scales.

Compared to the original YOLOv8 model, the YOLOv8 Nano model has a reduced number of layers and parameters, resulting in faster inference times and lower memory requirements. However, this reduction in complexity may lead to a slight decrease in detection accuracy, especially for small or heavily occluded objects.

Overall, the YOLOv8 Nano model is a suitable choice for applications where real-time object detection is required on devices with limited computational resources.
